definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: (also, in n.pr. [[אֶל]], [[אֱלִי]]; Sam. [[אל]], Ph. [[אל]], [[אלן]] (i.e. prob. [[אֵלֽן]]), Sab. [[אל]], DHM:Or. Congr. Leiden, 1883, As. ilu, Dl:w; perhaps also Ar., Aram. cf. Nö:l. c.; on goddess [[אלת]] Ph. Palm. Nab. Sab. (also [[אלהת]]) DHM:l. c; Ar. 0’ila0hah:un (pl. 0’ila0hat) Fl:kl. Schr. i. 154, As. Allatu Jr:66, Syr. 0alohota0, cf. also Bae:Rel 58, 90, 97, 271, 207) god, but with various subordinate applications to express idea of might;—hardly ever in prose exc. with defining word (adj. or gen.); its only suff. is [[י]]—[[ִ]];—†

applied to men of might and rank, [[אֵל גוים]] mighty one of the nations Ez Eze 31:11 (of Neb.; LXX a)/rxwn e)/qnwn, [[איל]] some MSS. Co); [[אֵלִים]] mighty men Job 41:17 ([[אילים]], many MSS. Di); [[אֵלֵי גִבּוֹרִים]] mighty heroes Ez Eze 32:21 ([[אֵילֵי]] MSS. Co); [[אֵילֵי הָאֶרֶץ]] Ez Eze 17:13, 2Ki 24:15 (Kt [[אולי]]); [[אֵילִים]] Ex 15:15 (prob. pl. of III. [[אַיִל]], q.v.) These readings are uncertain because of an effort to distinguish these forms from the divine name. [[אֵל גִּבּוֹר]] mighty hero (as above) ordivine hero (as reflecting the divine majesty) Is 9:6. †

gods of the nations, [[אֵל אֵלִים]] God of gods, supreme God Da 11:36; [[מִי כָמׂכָה בָּאֵלִם]] who is like thee among the gods Ex 15:11; idols Is 43:10, Is 44:10, Is 44:15, Is 44:17, Is 46:6; [[מי]] [[אל בשמים]] what God in heaven De 3:24; [[אֵל אחר]] another god Ex 34:14 (J); [[אֵל זר]] foreign god Ps 44:21, Ps 81:10; [[אל נכר]] De 32:12, Mal 2:11, Ps 81:10. †

definitions.title: n.pr.
definitions.body: [[אל ברית]] Ēl Berith Ju Jdg 9:46 (= [[בעל ברית]] Ju Jdg 8:33, Jdg 9:4) cf. also

as characterizing mighty things in nature, [[חררי אל]] mighty mountains Ps 36:7 (lit. mountains of Ēl); also Ps 50:10 Ol Bi Che v. sub II. [[אלף]]; [[ארזי אל]] mighty cedars Ps 80:11; [[כוכבי אל]] lofty stars Is 14:13.

God:217, the one only and true God of Israel: (a) [[הָאֵל]] the God, the true God Ge 31:13, Ge 35:1, Ge 35:3, Ge 46:3 (E) 2Sa 22:31, 2Sa 22:33,  2Sa 22:48 (= Ps 18:31, Ps 18:33, Ps 18:48) Ps 68:20, Ps 68:21, Ps 77:15; [[הָאֵל הַגֶּאֱמָן]] the faithful God De 7:9; [[האל]] [[הגדול]] the great God De 10:17 = Je 32:18, Da 9:4, Ne 1:5, Ne 9:32; [[האל הקדשׁ]] the holy God Is 5:17; [[האל]] [[יהוה]] the God Yahweh Is 42:5, Ps 85:9. † (b) [[אֵלִי]] my God Ex 15:2 (poet.) Ps 18:3, Ps 22:2, Ps 22:2, Ps 22:11, Ps 63:2, Ps 68:25, Ps 89:27, Ps 102:25, Ps 118:28, Ps 140:7, Is 44:17. (c) cstr. [[אל בית אל]] the God of Bethel, who had his seat there Ge 35:7 (E); [[אל אביך]] God of thy fathers Ge 49:25 (poet.); [[אל ישראל]] Ps 68:36; [[אל יעקב]] Ps 146:5; [[אל]] [[השמים]] the God of heaven Ps 136:26; [[אל סלעי]] the God who is my rock Ps 42:10; [[אל שמחת גילי]] the God who is the joy of my exultation Ps 43:4; [[אֵל רֳאִי]] the God who lets himself be seen Ge 16:13 (J); [[אל הכבוד]] the God of glory Ps 29:3; [[אל דעות]] the all-knowing God 1Sa 2:3 (poet.); [[אֵל עוֹלָם]] the everlasting God Ge 21:33 (J); [[אל ישועתי]] Is 12:2; [[אל חַיׇּ֑י]] Ps 42:9; [[אל אמת]] Ps 31:6 = [[אל אֱמוּנׇה]] De 32:4 (poet.); [[אל נקמות]] Ps 94:1, Ps 94:1; [[אל גְּמֻלוֹת]] Je 51:56. (d) [[אל אֶחָד]] one God Mal 2:10; [[אל גדול]] a great God De 7:21, Ps 77:14, Ps 95:3; [[אל מסתתר]] a God hiding himself Is 45:15; [[אל רחום]] a compassionate God Ex 34:6 (J) De 4:31, Ps 86:15; [[אל נשא]] a forgiving God Ps 99:8; [[אל חַנּוּן]] a gracious God Ne 9:31, Jon 4:2; [[אל קנא]] a jealous God Ex 20:5, Ex 34:14 (J) De 4:24, De 5:9, De 6:15, Jos 24:19 (D) = [[אל קנוא]] Na 1:2; [[אֵל חי]] a living God Jos 3:10 (J) Ho 2:1, Ps 42:3, Ps 84:3; [[אל חדיק]] Is 45:21; [[לא אֵל חפץ רשע]] Ps 5:5; [[לא אֵל]] De 32:21 (poet.) Is 31:3, Ez Eze 28:2, Eze 28:2, Eze 28:9; [[מי אל כמוךָ]] Mic 7:18 (cf. Ex 15:11). (e) God (the only true God, needing no article or predicate to define him) Nu 12:13 (E rd. [[אַל]] Di) always in poetry, Job 5:8 + (55 t. Jb), Ps 7:12, Ps 10:11, Ps 10:12, Ps 16:1, Ps 17:6, Ps 19:1, Ps 52:3, Ps 52:7, Ps 55:20, Ps 57:3, Ps 73:11, Ps 73:17, Ps 74:8, Ps 77:10, Ps 78:7, Ps 78:8, Ps 78:18, Ps 78:19, Ps 78:34, Ps 78:41, Ps 82:1, Ps 83:2, Ps 90:2, Ps 104:21, Ps 106:14, Ps 106:21, Ps 107:11, Ps 118:27, Ps 139:17, Ps 139:23, Ps 149:6, Ps 150:1, Is 40:18, Is 43:12, Is 45:14, Is 45:20, Is 46:9, La 3:41, Ho 11:9, Ho 12:1, Mal 1:9; [[עִמָּנוּאל]] God is with us, as name of child in prediction Is 7:14 cf. Is 8:8, Is 8:10. (f) Ēl, a divine name [[אל אלהי ישראל]] Ge 33:20 (E); [[אל אלהי]] [[הרוחות]] Nu 16:22 (P = [[יהוה אלהי הרוחות]] Nu 27:16); [[אל אלהים יהוה]] Jos 22:22 (P) Ps 50:1. This is probable also in the ancient poems, Nu 23:8, Nu 23:19, Nu 23:22, Nu 23:23, Nu 24:4, Nu 24:8, Nu 24:16, Nu 24:23 (poet. Balaam ‖[[שדּי]] & [[עליון]]) De 32:18, De 33:26 (poet. Moses ‖[[חוּר]] & [[אֱלֽהֵי קֶדֶם]]) 2Sa 22:32, 2Sa 23:5 (poet. David ‖[[חוּר]]) and in the combinations [[אל עליון]] (5 t.; vid. [[עליון]]) & [[אל שדּי]] (10 t.; vid. [[שַׁדַּי]]).

[[אֵל]] strength, power (on connection with I. [[אָלָה]] cf. Di Ge 1:1, Ge 31:29) in [[יֶשׁ־לְאֵל יׇדִי]] it is according to the power of my hand = it is in my power, etc. Ge 31:29 (E; sq. [[לְ]] + Inf.); [[בִּהְיוֹת לְאֵל]] [[יׇדְ֠יךָ]] Pr 3:27 (sq. id.); [[יֶשׁ־לְאֵל יׇדָם]] Mic 2:1; (abs.); neg. [[וְאֵין לְאֵל יׇדֶָךָ]] De 28:32 (abs.) = thou shalt be powerless, so Ne 5:5.
